summary: This bill, the Closing the Bump Stock Loophole Act of 2025, amends U.S. law to prohibit the import, sale, manufacture, transfer, or possession of devices that increase the rate of fire of semi-automatic firearms, specifically targeting bump stocks and similar modifications. It defines 'semi-automatic firearm' and mandates registration for firearms modified before the bill's enactment. Exemptions are provided for government entities and registered firearms. The bill also amends the National Firearms Act to include modified semi-automatic firearms, as defined, under its purview.
